document.title: A Model for Ethylene Receptor Function and 1-Methylcyclopropene Action
document.abstract: This paper provides a comprehensive review of current understanding of ethylene receptors, signal transduction using Arabidopsis as the model plant. It discusses the current theory on the mechanism of ethylene binding and proposes a mechanism for the action of ethylene response inhibitors such as 1-MCP.
document.publication-title: Faculty Publications and Other Works -- Biochemistry, Cellular and Molecular Biology

field.name: custom_citation
field.value: Binder, B.M. and Bleecker, A.B. 2003. A MODEL FOR ETHYLENE RECEPTOR FUNCTION AND 1-METHYLCYCLOPROPENE ACTION. Acta Hort. (ISHS) 628:177-187 http://www.actahort.org/books/628/628_21.htm
